summary: This bill, known as the Maintaining Academy Culture and Assuring Retention of Tradition, Honor, and Unity of the Republic Act (MACARTHUR Act), directs the Secretary of the Army to amend the mission statement of the United States Military Academy to explicitly include the phrase "Duty, Honor, Country" within 30 days of the bill's enactment. It also expresses the sense of Congress that these principles should be deeply embedded in the Academy's ethos and instilled in each cadet.
